result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamell Marquise Ward

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Sarah Mackenzie Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a calendar call. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense counsel advises the court he has been unsuccessful in contacting client.  State moves the court to lift the stay and issue a bench warrant.
Court LIFTS THE STAY and ordered bench warrant issued, remand to Commissioner, and NO action on bail.

Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case calendared for a final pre-trial. DEFENDANT FAILED TO APPEAR. Defense has no explanation for defendants non appearance and  request a calendar call date.  
Court ordered bench warrant issued, remand to the Commissioner, and no action on bail but STAYED issuance until the next court date.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 30. Court vacates 7/18/2022 jury trial date.  Calendar call scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Jamell Marquise Ward in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamell Marquise Ward appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
received and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jamell Marquise Ward in court with attorney Julita Kishma de Leon.  Defendant Jamell Marquise Ward in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jamell Marquise Ward appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
